intro: Erigeron flagellaris, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the stems are often sparsely branched. Erigeron flagellaris is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
